page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: The private motor car is the favourite means of transport. There is usually one to every househol and often two. Those people who do not have a car do have a bus service, but it is limited. There are 7 buses per day to Rye and 6 to Hastings. There is no Sunday service and the last buses go through about 6 p.m. If you wish to travel to London or betond yb train you can go via Rye (eastwards) or via Robertsbridge (westwards), but either way the journey takes two hours. The bicycle is sometimes used by both young and older folk, but due to the speed of the traffic it is considered a risk. A 40 mph speed limit was introduced in l985. Udimore has a high percentage of heavy goods vehicles on its B2089 road and it is quite a dangerous road.
